item.title: Former College IT technican Babar Ahmad sentenced to 12.5 years in prison
item.author: Joseph A L Letts,
item.description: Former College alumnus and IT staff member Babar Ahmad has been sentenced to 12 and a half years in prison after a long battle by US prosecutors in Connecticut. Ahmad admitted to “conspiracy and providing material to support the Taliban.” This result followed an eight-year legal battle …

item.title: College Animal Research Licence Holder Resigns from Role after Animals in Science Committee Report
item.author: Joseph A L Letts,
item.description: Today during a statement by Norman Baker MP, it has emerged that the College’s Establishment Licence Holder has resigned from the position with immediate effect. This decision follows a report published last week on breaches of animal research regulation that have occurred within the last few years. …

item.title: New Report Published About Animal Research Problems at College
item.author: Joseph A L Letts,
item.description: “The regime at ICL [Imperial College London] clearly fell short of the standard required by the Animals (Scientific Procedures) Act 1986 (ASPA)” according to yesterday’s report by the government’s Animals in Science Committee (ASC). The report, carried out by a Working Group of the ASC, provides a …

item.title: College Acquiring New Sports Ground in West London
item.author: Joseph A L Letts,
item.description: College is in the final stages of buying a new 27-acre plot of land two miles from Harlington for the use of Imperial’s sports teams.
